intro: Pilea longibracteolata, commonly known as the long-bract pilea, is a species of flowering plant in the family Urticaceae. It is native to tropical regions of South America, particularly Brazil and Peru. The plant is characterized by its small, heart-shaped leaves and clusters of yellowish-green flowers. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid forests. Its botanical features make it a popular choice for indoor gardening due to its aesthetic appeal and relatively low maintenance requirements.
